If education is listed as a mandatory requirement, only degrees obtained from an institution accredited by an accrediting organization recognized by the Secretary, US Department of Education will be accepted. As a condition of employment at NGA, persons being considered for employment must meet NGA fitness for employment standards. In accordance with section 9902(h) of title 5, United States Code, annuitants reemployed in the Department of Defense shall receive full annuity and salary upon appointment. They shall not be eligible for retirement contributions, participation in the Thrift Savings Plan, or a supplemental or redetermined annuity for the reemployment period. Discontinued service retirement annuitants (i.e., retired under section 8336(d)(1) or 8414(b)(1)(A) of title 5, United States Code) appointed to the Department of Defense may elect to be subject to retirement provisions of the new appointment as appropriate. (See DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 300, at http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives.) All candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or sexual orientation. NGA provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Applications will only be accepted online. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify us at recruitment@nga.mil. We are committed to saving lives and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do. Our impact is real and we see it every single day. We help get life-saving drugs into the hands of those who need them most.Who are you?You are a data analyst with a strong analytical mindset! As the liaison between the Request for Information (RFI) team and our subject matter experts, you are the gatekeeper of all client-facing metrics that are required to deliver high-quality sales and marketing materials. You arm our Business Development teams and key operational folks with the data they need to deliver the best message to our clients and prospects.You are a hard worker who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Your attention to detail has won you praise and you are regularly commended for meeting and beating deadlines. Your career trained you to be incredibly thorough and, like a detective, you comb through information, checking for inaccuracies and inconsistencies. You feel most at home managing the integrity of data and providing standardized data review, cleaning, and evalution. The accuracy and reliability of your work is unquestioned.In this next step on your journey, you want to put your detailed, analytical nature to work in an environment in which you can sharpen your business acumen, learn the CRO industry from the inside out, and gain visibility and recognition. Additionally, you want to work for a company that both supports your professional growth and helps you find a work/life balance that lets you pursue your career passion and still be you. Most of all, you want to do it in a place where you’re part of a team of experts as zealous about their work as you are—a place where you can really make a difference.You are an RFI Data Analyst.ResponsibilitiesWhat will you be doing?As an RFI Data Analyst, you are a key member of the Proposals team; working closely with the writers, Therapeutic Expertise, and Business Development teams to generate accurate, high-quality experience data for inclusion in RFIs and other sales/marketing materials. You will have the opportunity to work collaboratively with Therapeutic Expertise, Operational Reporting, Human Resources, and other business units to develop guidelines and optimal metrics reporting for each respective division within our organization.Key responsibilities include:Generate reports from PRA’s systems and contribute to the development of new reports and dashboards.Using Microsoft Excel, create relevant, usable client-ready tables and charts for inclusion in RFIs and other sales/marketing documents, including written and visual presentations. For example, study/employee experience summaries, staff headcount summaries, and regulatory submission metrics compiled from data lists.Perform maintenance and oversight of the RFI team’s source data and our metrics-related SharePoint files.Identify needs for data cleanup and coordinate with respective teams.Perform maintenance and oversight of the RFI Team’s metrics-related guidance documents.Proactively respond to metrics-related requests from internal/external clients.Support activities associated with the analysis and reporting of clinical data.Maintain high standards for data quality and accuracy.Work independently to meet predefined project timelines and goals.QualificationsWhat do you need to have?Undergraduate degree from an accredited institution or equivalent work experience. Degree in Business, Analytics, or Science is preferred.1-2 years of professional experience required; 3-5 years of professional experience, preferred, including:Applied analytical and strong organizational abilities and a dedication to quality and reliability in all work tasks.Demonstrated data analysis skills, including the ability to create effective and strategic summaries/deliverables.Ability to manage relationships with internal customers.Must be able to work under deadline pressure, but maintain accuracy and detail.Knowledge of CRO/pharmaceutical industry is preferred.MS Office Suite; very high level of proficiency and comfort with Excel (eg, detailed pivot tables and VLOOKUP) and high level of proficiency and comfort with Word and PowerPoint.Experience with SharePoint.Must read, write, and speak fluent English.Role is currently fully remote. Employee Assistance Program Medicare – Employee and City each pay 1.45%.RETIREMENT Employer paid membership in the State of Nevada Public Employees Retirement System (PERS). No Social Security tax on employee's wages. Retirement Health Savings (RHS) program. Service based retiree health insurance subsidy.PAID TIME OFF (PTO) From date of hire, employee is credited with a minimum of 18 days* of PTO prorated by the number of full months remaining in the calendar year, not including the month of hire. In January of each year, employee will be provided with a lump sum annual allocation of PTO as follows: Second year through fifth calendar years of service – 22 days Sixth year through twelfth calendar years of service – 26 days Thirteenth calendar year of service and beyond – 30 daysActual number of days of PTO granted may vary by position.Bereavement Four consecutive days of leave, with pay, per occurrence, to attend funeral for immediate family member.Holidays 12 paid holidays per year.Banked Holidays Holidays that fall on a day the employee is not scheduled to work will be banked. Employees may accumulate up to 152 hours of banked holiday hours at any given time.Floating Holidays Employee credited with two (2) floating holidays at the beginning of each calendar year. If hired prior to July 1, employee will be credited with two (2) floating holidays and if hired between July 1 and October 31, employee will be credited with one (1) floating holiday.WORK WEEK Four day, 9.5 hour work day, 38 hour work week. Four day, 10 hour work day, 40 hour work week for Police PERS positions.VOLUNTARY BENEFITS IRC 457 Deferred Compensation Plan IRC 401A Deferred Compensation Plan (new/re-hired employees only) IRC125 Plan Flexible Benefits Plan Cancer/Catastrophic Illness, Accident, Short Term Disability Insurance Auto and Home Insurance 529 College Savings Plan Supplemental Term Life Insurance Legal Insurance Pet Insurance Identity and Credit Protection Employee Network MembershipNOTE: Benefits subject to change based on the discretion of the City Manager or City Council. This professional will start off working with ASHLIN’s cloud-based visualization platform, CompassBI, powered by Sisense, on visualizing descriptive statistics and other key performance indicators and building ASHLIN’s library of dashboard templates. Additional projects will include supporting our team of project specialist in developing deliverables to our clients, based research and analysis methods, using statistical models on business data collected in field. Candidates should also be comfortable preparing routine as well as ad-hoc business reports and PowerPoint decks to present the information to senior management and clients.Essential duties and responsibilities:· Develop visualizations using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI and/or Sisense· Use sophisticated data analysis methods to support project team in creating deliverable for client· Work with clients to devise methods to optimize data capturing schemes and overall program evaluation plan Perform statistical modeling (e.g. ANOVA) using statistical software applications such as R and SPSS· Work with Senior Database Architect(s) to develop analytical SQL queries and reports for tracking, trending, and interpreting business data· Perform ongoing data quality assessments, identify discrepancies/inconsistencies, and resolve them· Continually improve the end-to-end process of data collection, transformation, analysis, and reporting· Develop data management programs and forms for data entry and maintenance by end-users· Document data analysis and reporting architecture, designs, and write user guides· Other duties as defined by senior research teamQualificationsTo be insights in order to make recommendations to senior management what steps to take§ Present data, interpretation and resulting strategy in language that indicates a command of the material while at the information and preserve the confidentiality of the information,§ Detail oriented and capable of identifying and resolving data quality issues.In addition, the following are highly desirable:§ A minimum of 3 years’ experience with statistical analysis tools (e.g. R, SPSS)§ A background in market research, or related disciplines§ Working knowledge of relational databases (e.g. SQL)Position CBRE /rc/clk?jk=02c46bfdddaf5bd1&fccid=c9b9e477b3c84b4d&vjs=3 CBRE is looking for a Data Analyst to perform collection, cleansing, and upload of CMMS Data for a large technology client in Sunnyvale, CA. This is not a remote role.RESPONSIBILITIESPrimary Responsibilities: Coordinate the collection, cleansing, and upload of CMMS Data. Interact with customers and the system to facilitate the full lifecycle of Data Collection for CMMS Data. Participate on improvement projects to the systems used to facilitate the data collection processes. Perform analysis on data to resolve issues. Make necessary preparations to support the Data Collection and upload process.The role of Data Quality Analyst facilitates the life cycle of CMMS data collection for construction projects. The role maintains the content of dashboards and provides regular reports to stakeholders. The role takes requests and launches Data Collection projects. Each project is validated against the Data Quality Business Rules, then the role engages the correct resources to complete the validations. The role works with the requesters to make the required corrections to completion. The role will guide the data to the final upload. The role will participate in improvement projects for the systems that are used to facilitate the delivery of CMMS Data.The role prepares template, files, data, and other requirements to support the data collection and upload process. The role will also perform data analysis to determine the correct course of action for reported issues.The ideal candidate would be someone with passion for data quality and the value it brings to the business.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESThe Data Quality Program Manager keeps the Data Collection process and Data Quality issue resolution on track. This is critical because the data loaded in the CMMS is the basis for Maintenance activities. Data must be accurate and on time for the operation to keep a high degree of reliability.Specific ResponsibilitiesSupport the identification, anomaly detection, and cleansing of data from various sources.Track the progress of all Data Collection projects using dashboards.Create, update, and close bugs for all Data Collection projects.Update bugs as required to progress, communicate, and memorialize actions taken in each Data Collection project.Prepare templates, files, data and other requirements to support data collection, upload, and issue correction.Perform data analysis to determine options for reported data quality issues.Support alignment of data to the standardsInteract with internal customers regarding data and issue correction.General Role Requirements:Manage project action items and follow-up commsManage project schedules and track changesRecord meeting minutes and manage communications with key stakeholdersManage project documentation, revision control and sites pageBuild and communicate status reportsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESNo formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Our vision: No one goes hungry, our Mission: Nourish people. Build solutions. Empower communities. We are an equal opportunity employer and are known for our core values of Respect, Integrity, Compassion, Dedication, Teamwork, and Fun!POSITION SUMMARYThe Food Bank of Central &amp; Eastern N.C is looking for a Data Analyst with a passion to serve others in our mission to end hunger in our community. Our network of 900+ food pantries, community kitchens, and other partner agencies helped serve and distribute 34,574,098 pounds of food last year to individuals who are at risk for hunger. As part of the IT team, you will be supporting our efforts to utilize data to more effectively understand and serve those in our service area. We’re looking for a data-savvy professional who can uncover the story behind numbers and tell that story to both technical and non-technical audiences to drive strategy for our organization. If you have a proven track record and passion for analyzing, communicating, modeling, mapping, and visualizing purposeful data, and a collaborative and analytical approach to your work, we highly encourage you to apply.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSDevelop, Implement and Maintain Data Strategy and InfrastructureAdvises Director of IT on best data practices, necessary infrastructure, reporting and business intelligence tools and other technology necessary to support key analytic activities.Develops data governance and analysis protocols.Identifies, sources, and support cleansing new and existing data sources to improve our ability to advocate, fundraises, and explain to donors the needs of those we serve. Lead Data and Statistical Analysis InitiativesWork with management team and department leaders to structure an analytic environment that supports ongoing problem-solving, leveraging expanding data tied to people and ending hunger.Create models to identify trends and track changes across time.Locate and define any new food bank process improvement opportunities and identify and recommend ways to optimize resources by streamlining efforts.Develop analytical presentations to share with key stakeholders, including members, research partners, and donors.Support Data Dissemination Activities and Related ToolsAct as point person for performing rigorous statistical data analysis in-house to support organizational needs.Design and deploy reports, dashboards, and other analytical solutions as necessary.Train staff on use of reports, dashboards and other BI tools.Automates dissemination of data products as practical to improve accuracy and efficiency.Perform other work-related duties as assigned.Act as a Liaison to University PartnersEngage local universities and leverage their resources to expand data analysis capabilities of the Food Bank.Develop a consortium of university partners that come together periodically to share learning and collaborate for the betterment of the Food Bank.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS, QUALIFICATIONS, &amp; EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree with 3 years of experience or equivalent experience in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, economics, social science research, or another related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.A thorough understanding of data analysis, data management, and related BI tools. Demonstrated success in team environments as well as competencies in adaptability, collaboration, and communication. Ability and willingness to learn new technologies.Experience in statistical or other data analysis.Strong and proven understanding of data cleanup challenges, data management strategies, and logical database design.Experience working with databases and manipulation of data.Proficiency in MS Office applications.Proficiency with Tableau/other BI tools such as PowerBI and JetReports.Experience with Azure technologies (AzureSQL, etc.) preferredExperience utilizing consuming data via APIs.The ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.Committed to organizational mission of ending hunger.PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully.While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk, hear, and interact without deliberate impediment (e.g., wearing or listening to headphones, etc.). The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb, balance, lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, and to stoop, crouch, or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.CONTACTSDaily contact and interaction with Food Bank staff and external parties, including Board members, community members, partner agency representatives, and the general public.WORKING CONDITIONSWhile performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to work in an office setting, which may require extended periods of sitting and the frequent use of a computer.Frequently, the employee will be required to drive an automobile.Other physical demands include the ability to stand and walk during training, carrying materials and hand-outs, flip charts and other audio-visual equipment.The employee will be required to interact with Food Bank personnel in the warehouse(s). In doing so, the employee will occasionally be exposed to moving mechanical parts and vehicles.The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.Occasional weekend and evening work may be necessary.Requires the ability to rapidly adapt and evolve, requiring continual upgrading of skills.EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERWe are an equal opportunity employer. We do not regard race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, pregnancy, marital status, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation or any protected class characteristic when seeking to hire. This practice, in addition to hiring, applies to our recruiting, training, transfers, promotions, job benefits, pay, dismissal practices, social and recreational activities, and any other term or condition of employment. We care about our employees, our candidates, and our community.As such, please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.***JOB SCAM ALERT***We have recently become aware that individuals not associated with Jack Morton have fraudulently used our name – and the names of some of our employees – to solicit applications for fake jobs, to conduct fake job interviews and to make fake job offers. Any request to schedule an interview and any bona fide offer of employment will only come from an authorized representative of Jack Morton with an email address "@jackmorton.com". We will never require an applicant to provide credit card or banking information to cover any supposed advance costs.If you have provided personal information in connection with a fake job offer or interview and you are concerned, we suggest that you take appropriate action.Jack Morton takes these activities very seriously and are taking appropriate steps to shut down this fraudulent activity.We urge you to be careful when sharing your personal information and to be aware of scams involving fake job postings and job offers. The Business Development Analyst will support the entire field sales and national account organizations with business intelligence tools to aid in the achievement of specific sales, distribution, and share goals. The Business Development Analyst will interpret sales data and make recommendations to the team. They will prepare and present findings to the executive team, retailers, and distributors. This role will work closely with the Business Development Director and Business Development Specialist.Duties and Responsibilities:Analyze depletion and syndicated sales data to measure Deschutes performance against KPI's, competition, and consumer growth trends - including volume goals, dollar share, distribution, and rate of sale.Collaborate with the sales team to develop broad based and persuasive sales stories and tools to support the sales organization in winning at retail with customers.Assist the national account team with work associated with developing presentations to retailers and distributors designed to help them increase sales and maximize profit.Support entire sales organization with timely analysis of sales, distribution, and pricing trends that support specific market and chain objectives.Develop and maintain a library of turnkey PowerPoint and Excel sales files that can be customized to specific geographies, products, and time periods for use in distributor and retailer presentations.Perform customer insights analysis including industry evaluations, market conditions, retail and consumer trends, and competitor analysis.Perform market and retailer analysis for national accounts to determine opportunities to expand Deschutes distribution and identify new placement opportunities.Business Planning:Support the Business Development team in the development, approval, and implementation of the annual sales volume and budget plan.Proactively report major positive or negative variances to key stakeholders and participate in the development of recommendations to address variances as needed.Pricing:Partner with Finance in price to retailer and price to consumer analysis.Use price to consumer data by market to develop potential annual price to retailer increases and discount programs.Conduct freight on board analysisNational Account Initiative/Deschutes KPI &amp; Company Goal Tracking:Build and update a brand health and performance dashboard that details progress toward quarterly KPIs and annual goals.Develop and present a monthly analysis of national account programs and initiatives.National Account Admin Support with Key Retailers - New item set-up, pricing submissions, updating images, insight slides for syndicated slides.Required Qualifications and Education:4-year college degree or equivalent combination education and experience.Minimum 2 years' experience in CPG and must display product and industry knowledge.Advanced level use of Symphony IRI database. Familiarity with CRM platforms, preferably VIP/KARMAAdvanced level computer skills expert level in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to gather and analyze data from multiple sources and translate it into actionable insights.Able to break problems/information down in order to systematically identify problems/opportunities and make recommendations for their resolution.Able to clearly express ideas, information, or concerns in a straightforward manner and to key stakeholders within the organization.Highly motivated, self-starter, results oriented and ability to adapt to changing priorities with a focus on timelines.Strong analytical skills and ability to synthesize data into insights and compelling selling stories.Strong presentation skills.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working with key National Account Retailers: Kroger, Walmart, Safeway/Albertsons.Additional skills in selling, negotiating, and marketing.Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job, and that candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background. We would encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of our qualifications described. If you are unsure whether you meet the qualifications of this position, or how this would be determined, please feel free to contact HR@deschutesbrewery.com to discuss your application. Careful documentation of work is essential in managing data. Prepare and manipulate spreadsheets and databases to generate tables, charts, maps, and other visual representations of data or information. Submit reports as required by program funders or internally as needed Specific activities include:Manage submission of monthly and quarterly reporting deliverables to TWV fundero Review and clean monthly and quarterly reports submitted by TWV siteso Monitor and review monthly coach data submissiono Investigate reporting and resolve issues of questionable data or missing informationo Provide technical assistance as requested to TWV coaches and communities regarding data reporting requirements and processSupport community needs assessmentso Support program activities to disseminate and collect community social network surveys, including uploading respondent list, managing survey emails and schedules, and updating respondent contact informationo Track receipt of assessment documents from TWV communities and submission to TWV fundero Populate assessment results into TWV community presentation materialso Upload materials to TWV Web Portal and notify coaches when materials are available for community useOther duties as assigned; may include, but are not limited to the following: Provide data collection and analysis for other programs as assigned Assist with design and implementation of research projects and proposals Assist with responding to inquiries from a variety of constituents and stakeholders, which may include the Veterans Administration, WICHE Commission members, state agency officials, and the media as assigned Assist with highlighting and disseminating WICHE’s initiatives and the work of the Behavioral Health ProgramRequired Education, Skills, and Experience1. Demonstrated quantitative literacy and competency in managing quantitative data accurately and efficiently using spreadsheets and database applications, including careful documentation.3. Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel.6. Ability to establish and maintain effective, cooperative, and cordial working relationships.7. Master’s degree in a field appropriate to the research and analysis of public policy, such as political science, higher education, public policy, sociology, or economics.2. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Proficiency with additional database/spreadsheet software such as Microsoft Access or SQL.3. Veteran of United States Armed Forces.TravelTDBAbout Together with VeteransTogether With Veterans (TWV) is a rural, community-based suicide prevention program. WICHE engages, trains, and supports local Veterans to lead planning and implementation of public health suicide prevention targeting Veterans and their families. The program is funded by the Veterans Administration Office of Rural Health, supported by the Office of Mental Health and Suicide Prevention, and carried out via collaboration between the VA Rocky Mountain Mental Illness Research, Education and Clinical Center for Suicide Prevention, WICHE, and rural Veterans and their local community partners.About the Behavioral Health ProgramWICHE’s Behavioral Health Program (BHP) provides technical assistance, education, consulting, and research services to strengthen behavioral health care in the West. Initiatives focus on analysis and growth of the behavioral health workforce, as well as overall improvements within the public mental health system. The BHP has a long history of providing mental health services in rural area, and for providing training to support prevention, treatment, and recovery efforts throughout the West.About WICHESince 1953, the Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education (WICHE) has been strengthening higher education, workforce development, and behavioral health throughout the region. As an interstate compact, WICHE partners with states, territories, and postsecondary institutions to share knowledge, create resources, and develop innovative solutions that address some of our society’s most pressing needs. From promoting high-quality, affordable postsecondary education to helping states get the most from their technology investments and addressing behavioral health challenges, WICHE improves lives across the West through innovation, cooperation, resource sharing, and sound public policy.BenefitsWICHE offers a competitive benefits package which includes medical insurance with generous employer contribution to health savings account (H.S.A.), dental, life, and disability insurance; flexible spending accounts (medical and dependent care); 403(b)retirement plan with employer match of 200% on employee contributions up to 5% after six full months of employment; and vacation accrual of four weeks per year, sick leave, paid holidays, and personal leave time.WICHE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, marital status, or any other legally-protected status. Applications by members of all underrepresented groups are encouraged. Boulder CO 80301 Data Specialist
City of Blaine /rc/clk?jk=69fb5db2d1d86b6a&fccid=7408eaf47ac106db&vjs=3 DescriptionUnder the general direction of the Special Operations Captain, this position is responsible for timely and accurate crime and intelligence information and analysis to support strategic, administrative and operational functions of the Blaine Police Department. Responsibilities include providing accurate and timely crime and intelligence information and analysis in support of patrol operations, criminal investigations, and crime prevention in support of agency goals and policing efforts. This position will work in collaboration with each of the Public Safety divisions to collect and analyze data to describe call-for-service needs, crime patterns, crime trends, and potential suspects; assist in the investigative process; increase the apprehension of offenders; aide in crime prevention efforts; and, assist in services delivery.Examples of DutiesProvide accurate, timely and relevant analysis of crime patterns, series and trends that aid in the efficient deployment of departmental resources and that increase apprehensions and the clearance of criminal cases.Create databases, timelines and link charts for analysis, extracting and verifying pertinent information, managing and organizing information, performing data mining, and proactively developing targets for further investigation.Analyze known offenders’ methods of operation and establish timelines to perform suspect/crime correlation in order to provide suspect leads and targets for surveillance or directed patrols.Assist in directing the investigation and prosecution of crimes by researching and gathering electronic information that can be utilized by investigators to develop leads, locate witnesses and/or suspects and strategically further a case. Work with investigators to obtain search warrants as needed in order to access private information.Provide statistical analysis to supervisors about the job productivity of employees by division or department.Provide statistical analysis and reporting of crimes, including predictive and/or patterned analysis, to identify current crime trends and make inferences of future criminal activities.Prepare monthly statistical analysis presentations and strategic assessments for use in budget projections and staffing deployments.Research, organize, compile and analyze data and information for assigned special projects.Create Blaine-based information advisories to share timely information with department staff, community members, local businesses and public safety partners.Provide staff with real-time intelligence during critical incidents.Manage department’s social media to enhance the department’s ability to solve crimes and share critical information in a timely manner.Network with analysts and crime prevention specialists from other departments to promote information sharing.Manage the information flow from regional, statewide and federal agencies in an accurate, efficient and legal manner.Take the lead role in providing analysis of information during multi-jurisdictional investigations.Attends regular roll calls with Patrol and Investigations to gather and disseminate information on criminal activity using GIS or related mapping to identify and plan targeted enforcement activities.Use crime mapping and geographic information systems to demonstrate relationships and enhance the visual presentation of the research data to prepare routine and comprehensive written reports upon request.Prepare routine and comprehensive written reports and make clear oral presentations upon request. Assist staff in the assembly and presentation of information for police initiatives as requested or needed.Respond to public inquiries regarding crime trends and crime prevention.Provide expert testimony as required.Perform other duties as assigned.Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesProficient knowledge in related State and Federal laws including the Minnesota Data Practices Act. Works with staff to ensure guidelines are adhered to.Knowledge of principles, practices, methodologies and techniques of crime analysis, crime prevention and law enforcement.In depth knowledge of private versus public information; high ability to ascertain appropriate timing to obtain a search warrant to obtain desired information.Ability to use past information to identify potential future crime information/patterns.Ability to identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.Knowledge of Community Policing and Problem Solving Policing concepts.Excellent oral and written communication skills including a high ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner.Proficient ability to write clearly and succinctly and tailor message to a variety of communication settings and styles.Proficient and demonstrated problem solving skills, including a high ability to: analytically examine a problem and identify a logical, systematic, sequential approach to solving; identify a set of features, parameters or considerations to take into account when determining a course of action; and, identify discrepancies and inconsistencies in available information; systematically compare two or more alternatives.Ability to prioritize work assignments and manage project timelines.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.Proficient in a variety of software applications including ArcGIS, Spatial Analyst and ATAC Raids.Supplemental InformationMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in Computer Forensics Geography, Computer Science, Criminology, Statistics, Criminal Justice, or closely related field.Crime Analyst Certification, or related.Two (2) years of responsible experience performing crime analysis.Five (5) years’ experience utilizing Microsoft Office (Work, Excel, and PowerPoint).DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONSGIS or computer-based analysis program experience.Experience working within law enforcement databases including, but not limited to, Department of Public Safety, Department of Corrections, Bureau of Criminal Apprehension ISS, JNet, E-charging, MNCIS, and other commercial and non-commercial web based databases.A+ Certification.i2 program experience.ArcGIS, Spatial Analyst and/or ATAC Raids software experience. Slalom Consulting /rc/clk?jk=4931cab975f3325f&fccid=a321096b9f1b3c50&vjs=3 Who You’ll Work WithOur Business Advisory Services teams help organizations of all kinds redefine what’s possible, give shape to the future—and get there. We focus on high-impact projects, meeting our clients where they are to uncover business needs and deliver results. Our teams go beyond the expected to help clients move confidently through ambiguity and risk and drive more transformative outcomes.Role DescriptionThe role of a Business Analyst is to understand complex client needs. This includes creating a shared understanding of the stated business problems and opportunities at the center of an initiative or program, as well as the solution proposed to achieve the desired business outcome. The Business Analyst’s primary objective is to elicit, analyze, and document the requirements of a project, program, or product, as well as communicate them clearly to stakeholders and manage requirement changes as necessary to maximize the value of the solution being delivered within existing constraints. Requirements are typically elicited and analyzed by conducting interviews and facilitating workshops with existing business stakeholders and by closely collaborating with the technical delivery teams and customers or end users.The Business Analyst should understand current and future processes, data, and systems to detail the consequences of making a business change to address a specific need. Business Analysts should be able to assess and validate if a solution has fulfilled the requirements as well as the stated business benefits of the initiative, using analytics tools and metrics as needed. A Business Analyst role often includes writing user stories and acceptance criteria to populate agile backlogs in most of our technology related client work.Core SkillsRequirements Elicitation, Analysis, &amp; DocumentationUser Story CreationStakeholder Engagement &amp; CommunicationIssue based Problem SolvingYou would enjoy this role if…You would enjoy this role if you are detail oriented, logical, and analytical, and like helping organizations improve operations and solve important business problems, especially with technology. A Business Analyst typically requires excellent requirements elicitation skills, design thinking acumen, a solid base of business understanding, and an awareness of technology/system development methodologies. The role calls for both hard and soft skills and is constantly evolving as teams and companies change operating models and rely more on data and automation to improve effectiveness and implement solutions.About UsSlalom is a modern consulting firm focused on strategy, technology, and business transformation. In 39 markets around the world, Slalom's teams have autonomy to move fast and do what's right. They are backed by regional innovation hubs, a global culture of collaboration, and partnerships with the world's top technology providers. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, Slalom has organically grown to over 8,000 employees. Slalom has been named one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For five years running and is regularly recognized by employees as a best place to work. Learn more at slalom.com.Slalom prides itself on helping team members thrive in their work and life. As a result, Slalom is proud it invest in benefits that include: meaningful time off and paid holidays, parental leave, 401(k) with a match, a range of choices for highly subsidized health, dental, &amp; vision coverage, adoption and fertility assistance, and short/long-term disability. We also offer additional benefits such as a yearly $350 reimbursement account for any well-being related expenses as well as discounted home, auto, and pet insurance.Slalom is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.#LI-CL1 Boston MA 02116 Business Analyst

Focused on direct to consumer certifications in the healthcare and IT fields, the eLearning school helps students gain the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in new careers and deliver employers the right candidates to fit their organization. MedCerts delivers certification and career training through HD-quality video-based instruction, virtual simulations, games and animations, and on-the-job training. Since 2009, the company has trained over 25,000 students in over 35 career programs and over 800 organizations using or hiring these students. For more information, visit: www.medcerts.com.GENERAL DESCRIPTIONThe Data and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for creating new, modifying existing, and performing ad-hoc reporting in support of business processes and data-driven decision making. reporting processes, bringing new insights to leaders in an interactive and timely manner.Use data modeling, prototyping, statistics, data mining, scenario analysis to collect, explore, and extract estimated/calculated business impact with Senior and Executive Leadership.Influence IT, and other partner orgs on needs for data infrastructure, data integrity, tools, etc.Identify and manage existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and processes.Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.Facilitate business projects of high complexity, size and visibility ensuring stakeholders champion decision making data needs.Lead or directs the design, development and implementation and provides oversight of the maintenance of complex and sometimes unique business solutions, which may include data, reporting, business intelligence or analytics.Utilize a comprehensive understanding of multiple data structures and sources to Lead or direct complex and sometimes unique data manipulation using advanced data extraction and analytical tools and techniques.Recognize the connection between the business operations and analytics to influence business strategies and solutions.Develops innovative reporting and story-telling approaches to address business problems and solutions.Responsible for ensuring That’s why we’ve taken a number of steps to help maintain a clean and safe environment where Team Members can thrive, and customers can feel safe. Currently, in our stores and Corporate offices, we're practicing social distancing, wearing face coverings (subject to certain exemptions), cleaning frequently, and following state and local requirements as well as Center for Disease Control (CDC) guidelines to help ensure a clean and safe environment for all. The company is one of the fastest growing startups in New York City and recently raised a $230 million investment led by Coatue in September 2020, just 5 months after its Series C round due to strong customer traction. Other investors in Attentive include Bain Capital Ventures, Sequoia, IVP.We work with 2,000+ of the most innovative brands like Sephora, Coach, Urban Outfitters, CB2, PacSun, Lulus, and Jack in the Box. Attentive was founded in 2016 by the co-founders of TapCommerce, a mobile marketing platform that was acquired by Twitter in 2014.Role Background:We are seeking an experienced and enigmatic Lead Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics team. You will be responsible for analytics needs across the organization, working with teams and leadership to define and shape self-service analytics and a data driven organization. You’ll also help establish the relationship between the Analytics team and the rest of the organization, empowering team members to reach out and request analytical support as they need it. If you are a self starter, excited about building a data driven culture, and motivated by making an impact, then you may be a good fit for this role.You @ Attentive:You will work with leads across the company to define analytics requirementsYou will develop dashboards for teams across the org to support key business decisionsYou will define business metrics and maintain a data dictionaryYou will work with Business Intelligence Engineers to model data in a scalable wayYou will define a process to triage and prioritize analytics requests from across the organizationYou have exceptional data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audienceYou have inherent curiosity, skepticism, and analytical follow-through - you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutionsYou are a self starter with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and identify opportunities with limited oversightYou have experience with designing self service analyticsYou have experience in statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, experimentation logic and biases)You have high proficiency with SQLYou have experience managing a modern BI tool like Looker or TableauYou have experience developing and documenting data modelsYou are a team player with excellent collaboration and communication skills6+ years of analytics experienceNice to have:You have experience managing small teams and/or projectsBenefits &amp; Perks:Robust health benefits packages including access to a 401k and various medical, dental and vision plans, and $100/month fitness reimbursementFull support for remote work during COVID-19Daily lunch delivery credit and other goodies sent to homeRegular company-wide social events (even virtually!)Generous annual education stipend toward job-related external learning opportunitiesAn extremely enthusiastic team that appreciates collaborationAttentive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Such topics will include students (e.g., enrollment, retention, degrees conferred, demographics) and faculty/staff (e.g., salaries, demographics, retention and turnover). The work will involve accessing existing data sources, and/or extracting, merging, collecting other necessary data. Data will be analyzed and reports or dashboards developed using querying tools (e.g., SQL, MS Access), MS Excel and Tableau. Results will be communicated, both oral and written, in a manner that is clear and easy to understand by stakeholders at all levels of data competency. The successful candidate will have a blend of quantitative, visualization, and communication skills. Alterra Mountain Company’s family of diverse playgrounds spans six U.S. states and three Canadian provinces: Steamboat and Winter Park Resort in Colorado; Squaw Valley Alpine Meadows, Mammoth Mountain, June Mountain and Big Bear Mountain Resort in California; Stratton and Sugarbush in Vermont; Snowshoe in West Virginia; Tremblant in Quebec, Blue Mountain in Ontario; Crystal Mountain in Washington; Deer Valley Resort and Solitude Mountain Resort in Utah; and CMH Heli-Skiing &amp; Summer Adventures in British Columbia. ArcBest /company/Project-Evident/jobs/Data-Analyst-063230e9d7b8b2f5?fccid=0b10ac4f43dc48bb&vjs=3 Job detailsSalary$49,753 - $113,331 a yearJob TypeFull-timeQualificationsBachelor's (Preferred)Machine Learning: 3 years (Preferred)Python: 1 year (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionJob Title: Data Analyst, EducationReports to: Director, Education PracticeFLSA Status: ExemptPrepared Date: February 2021Organization OverviewProject Evident exists to help organizations harness the power of evidence to achieve greater impact. We do this by offering a comprehensive platform of tools, resources, and services to help state education agencies, local education agencies, nonprofits and funders improve how they measure, evaluate, and report results, while strengthening their ability to act using this evidence.Project Evident strives to be a trusted partner – to practitioners, funders, and other stakeholders committed to stronger, meaningful, and equitable outcomes for communities and individuals so that all can participate, prosper, and reach their full potential.1 We believe in the power of data and evidence to address social and racial justice, and seek to advance a next generation ecosystem for actionable evidence building and use. We live into our mission through our values, specifically:Practitioner Focused - We center on practitioners, and ground our work in their needs and contexts. We help practitioners strengthen meaningful and equitable outcomes for the communities and individuals they serve, and lift up their work so it can be better understood and supported by funders and policy makers.Committed to Learning, Inclusion, and Transparency - We are frank, honest, and compassionate with our colleagues, clients, funders, and stakeholders. We seek input and feedback from a wide range of voices and share our learnings openly with others.We recognize that evidence is not immune from the racism and inequities that exist in our society, and strive to understand the context in which we operate and to uphold the principles of belonging, dignity, and justice through our work.Smart, Warm, Approachable and Productive - Smart - we strive to find practical, implementable solutionsWarm - we bring heart and positivity to our work and work through discomfortApproachable - we keep open and curious minds, welcoming differing viewpoints and valuing the ideas and experiences of our partners.1 Language drawn from PolicyLink’s definition of equity with their permission.Productive - we hold ourselves accountable to the goals and timelines we set with our colleagues and partners, and course correct as neededOriented to Actionable Evidence - We build and use relevant and timely data and evidence with our partners and ourselves to continuously learn, improve, and make meaningful, equitable, and cost effective decisions.Position Summary – Data AnalystThe data analyst reports to Director, Education Practice and is responsible for data collection, cleaning, analyses, visualization, and presentation. The majority of the data analyst’s work will focus on education; however, as a member of the Project Evident team, the analyst will also work in other content areas as needed.Essential DutiesData Analysis &amp; Programming Assemble, clean, manage, and analyze large longitudinal data sets derived from multiple sources.Evaluate data quality. Identify data outliers and anomalies that require resolution prior to analysis.Identify coding challenges and resolve or elevate them with the data team.Create robust, maintainable, well-documented scripts to automate common tasks.Appropriately structures data files depending on use, e.g., analysis, visualization, etc.Execute standard analyses and help develop customized analyses that address questions of core interest to partner organizations.Perform complex analytic tasks with supervision.Partner Support &amp; Communications Participate in presenting key research findings and recommendations to internal and external audiences.Contribute to drafting memos, reports, case studies, and presentations for partner leadership, including school boards, superintendents, and principals, as well as other stakeholders (e.g., advisors and funders).With guidance, provide training to external clients on specific tools and methods (e.g., data visualization in Tableau, formulas and pivot tables in Excel).Other Duties Perform literature and web searches, summaries, and reviews in support of ProjectEvident projects.Collaborate with members of the Project Evident team, with a focus on the EducationPractice, and partner organizations staff to continually refine analytic work products.Coordinate internal data collection and reporting efforts.Contribute to the development of new projects and proposals.Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Education and/or ExperienceMinimum Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, e.g., statistics, economics, econometrics, math, public policy or other related fields.Three years of related experience processing and analyzing data. Relevant coursework may count towards this experience.Basic statistical knowledge, including linear regression and hypothesis testing.Ability to complete tasks on tight deadlines without compromising quality.Preferred:Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g., statistics, economics, econometrics, math, public policy or other related fields.Two years of related work experience.Demonstrated experience in cleaning, managing, and analyzing large social-sector data sets, with a preference for working with student-level education dataExperience working with a data warehouse system and a clear understanding of common data warehousing best practices, key terms, and concepts.Survey design and analyses a plus.Familiarity with R, STATA, Tableau, or SQL.Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesMinimum Requirements:Excellent oral and written communication skills, with a proven ability to write clear and concise memos and explain technical concepts or data findings to a general audience.Ability to work with stakeholders to develop actionable metrics and data-driven insights.Experience working in a collaborative, team-based environment.Experience working effectively with multiple stakeholders who may have evolving priorities.Ability to interface with diverse staff and partners in various sectors.Experience and comfort working virtually.Experience using common cloud-based productivity tools, e.g.Google Drive, Office 365,Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Slack.Preferred:Experience working in the education sector. Education or non-profit consulting experience is a plus.Ability and experience working amongst a geographically distributed team/client baseOrganizational DemandsThe Data Analyst reports to the Director, Education Practice and works collaboratively with staff, clients, contractors and vendors on a weekly basis to meet goals in line with organizational values.Physical DemandsN/AWork EnvironmentAbility to work with a virtual team.Expected to work 40-50 hours per week.Up to 40% travel (In times when travel is standard practice and generally safe.)Submission and Interview ProcessCandidates wishing to be considered for this position, must submit a cover letter and resume.Reasonable accommodation will be made so that applicants with qualifying disabilities may participate in the application process. Holyoke Health Center /rc/clk?jk=5bdec45ae813e1c4&fccid=fd0ff7fee5f2deb2&vjs=3 Data AnalystThe Data Analyst will support the data needs for all quality performance measurement and improvement activities for the organization. This position support the organization through collection and analysis of targeted data and information to support HHC programs, initiatives and regulatory reporting requirements including: Quality initiatives, Meaningful Use, Uniform Data System (UDS), Patient Centered Medical Home (PCMH), Primary Care Payment Reform (PCPR), grant funded programs, and supporting the organizations ongoing data collection efforts. Duties include: design, develop, and generate customized ad-hoc reports; prepare and present information to designated committees or other internal and external groups; extract, organize, analyze, and report data to local, state and federal agencies; track and report key outcomes and trends using charts and graphs; collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to monitor and evaluate improvement initiatives; identify opportunities for improvement; and help transform data into actionable information. Requirements: a Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field required; 3-5 years experience, preferably in a health care setting; excellent analytical skills including the ability to understand and interpret quantitative and qualitative data; intermediate or higher level of proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Word, and Powerpoint (Pivot tables, calculations, statistic tools and charts/graphs); ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management; and must be proactive in nature. Previous experience using Electronic Health Record systems is preferred. Familiarity with SQL queries and generating reports with software products similar to crystal reports is also preferred. VMLY&R /rc/clk?jk=e855c70afb26f32b&fccid=95fa2b94b684ec6b&vjs=3 As a Data Analyst, you will analyze, prepare, and process data sets to be consumed for direct insights, statistical modeling or other analytical exploration for internal and external clients. You will be responsible for accessing and compiling data sets from various sources for exploratory and pre-defined analyses, audit data sets for completeness, validity and other pertinent data health measures. This includes creating reports/dashboards by using industry tools, SQL, Tableau and Business Objects. You will build, verify and maintain data integrity for data sets and queries used in analytics as well as collect and interpret data to provide insights for key areas of the hospital. You will also support evaluation of data sets for analytical possibilities and pitfalls, transform data for specific team functions or process as appropriate and conduct basic statistical testing and exploratory data analysis. Your responsibilities will also include creating basic data visualizations as well as consulting with stakeholders or clients on data availability, quality and outcomes of analysis. Finally, you will work alongside different departments to understand and establish business needs and establish documentation process for analytics requests, including recommendations for refining existing process.Back to DescriptionCerner Jobs and CareersClient ServicesWorking directly with our clients is one of the most impactful careers you will find. This role will be at the core of confirming compliance or identifying and remediating non-compliance by reporting and analyzing Banner’s vast amount of data.The analyst will be involved in developing complex SQL queries, generating reports, performing analysis, and building visuals to convey their findings. The analyst will also be involved in building out a data mart environment taking source data, digesting it, and structuring it in a meaningful and efficient manor while utilizing stored procedures, views, functions, indexes, etc. Analyst needs to be comfortable writing many joins and investigating complex datasets to identify how they may be related. While data science experience such as using R, Python, machine learning, SAS, etc. can complement this role, these skills will be utilized directly very rarely (these skillsets are not required).Analyst needs to be comfortable receiving lose requirements and working with internal customers to identify project objectives, collaborate to further define requirements, pull and validate the data, present the data to the end-users, and make refinements as needed. Strong communication and organizational skills are a must.Most data utilized by our team is stored in Teradata along with a small amount in Microsoft SQL Server. Applicant must be proficient is writing SQL in at least 1 database system. Dashboards and visualizations are presented in Tableau and occasionally in Excel; PowerBI may also be included. Our team only handles minimal amounts of ETL/ELT which is done in SAP Data Services or SSIS. Experience with Azure, including Azure SQL, Data Factories, and App Services is a plus but not required.Within Banner Health Corporate, you will have the opportunity to apply your unique experience and expertise in support of a nationally-recognized healthcare leader. We offer stimulating and rewarding careers in a wide array of disciplines. Whether your background is in Human Resources, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Managed Care Programs or Public Relations, you'll find many options for contributing to our award-winning patient care.POSITION SUMMARYThis position provides data analytics support to the Internal Audit and Corporate Compliance departments by utilizing standard data analytic methodologies and data extraction software. This includes data extraction and analysis from multiple applications, building complex reports and/or data repositories, developing relational data structures, identifying data analytic opportunities and providing project management which may include project development, presentation and implementation. The incumbent must have significant knowledge regarding healthcare operations in order to serve as a liaison and provide relevant guidance or leadership. This position is responsible for and/or participates in creating functional documentation, participating or reviewing technical documentation, system configuration, creating training materials and facilitating or leading cross functional teams through projects and/or issues to achieve desired results.CORE FUNCTIONS1. Plan and perform data analytic procedures that support Internal Audit and Corporate Compliance ongoing projects. Specific responsibilities will include; identification of data analytic opportunities, design and execution of audit tests based on identified risks, data extraction and analysis utilizing data interrogation software, report development and project management.2. Performs analysis of customer needs. Manages and supports the identification and research of new developments and uses of current systems and applications, as well as upgraded systems and applications to meet customer needs. Products may include, but are not limited to; online applications, complex reports.3. Serves as a liaison and expert resource for customers related to data analytics that may include data analysis, development of data or trending reports, project management, presentation and education.4. Maintains optimal operation of departmental application in partnership with IT or external software vendor, as appropriate. This may include leading the implementation, maintenance, testing and/or functional design.5. Keeps current on industry and regulatory/compliance issues within assigned areas. Provides system and reporting consultation on these issues to customers.6. Creates presentations and/or reports for management involving significant analysis of multiple or complex data sources.7. Develops interrelationships among partners and customers who might have similar information needs and manages those relationships to assure effective solutions.8. This position makes decisions using policies and guidelines, but must demonstrate expertise in applying solution to non-standard or routine situations.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSMust possess a strong knowledge as normally obtained through the completion of a bachelor's degree in a related business discipline or computer science.A level of experience as would typically be obtained in no less than three years’ working with complex data environments or systems. Designed to be easy to use for dealers, iPacket's patented technology provides a sales staff with a cloud-based digital portfolio of their dealership's available vehicle inventory and streamlines the process of presentation and communication with potential buyers. Access, share, and track vehicle portfolios with potential clients via email, text, or social media. There's more to a vehicle than a history report and price - join our talented team and let us show you.We are excited to be openly taking applications for the position of Data Analyst within our Data Analytics Team. As a member of our small but skilled team you will play a role in designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud infrastructure and software solutions that will help us mature our data pipeline and drive our visualization and reporting features. You will also take part in developing tools and statistical models that will make meaningful use of captured data to provide a variety of insights to clients. We are looking for candidates that are self-motivated and punctilious, eager to learn new technologies, and work well both within a team and on their own.Responsibilities:Develop services using Python to service multiple internal and external facing visualization and reporting applicationsHelp manage, maintain, and grow cloud-based data storage (SQL and NoSQL databases) and data pipeline solutionsHelp apply Machine Learning techniques to raw data sources and develop statistical models for analyzing and interpreting data in a meaningful wayContribute to developing test and maintaining high coverage of code bases that fall under the team's responsibility.Develop consumer grade analytics visualizations and reporting within the iPacket PlatformWork closely with other internal teams to make sure new feature developments fit seamlessly with existing platform components and meet the desired roadmap for their developmentAid in supporting the development and maintenance of existing platform featuresConsider and maintain the security and integrity of information being stored within the platform and delivered externally to clientsQualificationsA Bachelors of Science Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyStrong knowledge of and experience with relational database technologies (examples: HBase, MySQL, PostgreSQL)Experience with Python ProgrammingExperience with Unit and Regression Testing methodologiesStrong background in Mathematics / StatisticsFamiliarity with No-SQL / Non-relational Database Technologies (examples: Hive, MongoDB, Redis)Familiarity with the R Programming Language and/or Pandas and NumPy Python LibrariesFamiliarity with Message Broker and Process Queue technologies (ex. Southwest Healthcare System /rc/clk?jk=5ac7a96a1198368e&fccid=f79ee1a8bdca5db3&vjs=3 Game Circus LLCJob Description: Game Data Research AnalystFULL-TIME, REMOTE or OFFICEAbout Game CircusFounded in 2010 and based in Dallas, Texas, Game Circus develops and publishes some of the top free-to-play mobile games. Many of our games have amassed over 10,000,000+ downloads on both iOS and Android platforms. We have a casual studio atmosphere with experienced and talented individuals who strive to create the best mobile games that everyone can enjoy! We take pride in creating games that people play for years. Game Circus is well established, profitable, entirely self-funded, and privately owned. Unlike many game studios, Game Circus is both a game developer and game publisher. We design and build games we think will be successful and handle all aspects of game development in-house (Game Design, Art/Sound, Programming, Server Backend, Marketing, Publishing, and Quality Assurance).Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics Team. You will use various programming, statistical, and reporting tools to analyze and share results related to split testing, user acquisition, data mining, player behaviors, statistics, and machine learning. The Data Team works closely with our Game Designers &amp; Business Analysts to formalize and answer questions related to our games, players, in-game behaviors &amp; player value. We utilize many different algorithms, statistical models, and predictive models to answer these questions. The Data Analyst is responsible for: vetting in-game instrumentation, gathering and preparing data, preparing/running sophisticated SQL queries, writing python ETL processing steps, running ad-hoc analysis to answer questions, and finally, building Tableau dashboards and Jupyter Notebooks to share your work and analysis.Essential FunctionsWork with Game Designers to verify the implementation and accuracy of in-game instrumentation (data collected while players are playing our games)Work with Game Designers to identify and track key performance indicators (KPI's) related to our players (e.g., retention, monetization, engagement, and in-game behaviors) and help identify and model ways to improve the in-game experience for our players.Build tools for understanding and tracking the health of our games over time and across version updatesFormulate mathematical or simulation models of problems, relating constants and variables, restrictions, alternatives, conflicting objectives, and numerical parameters.Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.Perform advanced SQL queries in response to business needs. You should be very comfortable with advanced aggregation functions, windowing functions, datetime wrangling, and working with multiple layers of subselectsPerform analysis of real-time data flowing into and out of database systems and accurately interpret, prepare and communicate resultsPerform data manipulations such as data imports, wrangling, exports, and updatesAssist with data mining, API development, and connectivity with 3rd party data vendorsBuild and maintain Tableau Online dashboards; Experience with Dash and ShinyApps is a plus.Build and maintain Jupyter Notebooks (Python)Write and maintain Python-based ETL processes for ingesting and preparing data.Present the results of mathematical modeling and data analysis to management and othersCollaborate with others in the organization to ensure successful implementation of chosen problem solutionsDay-to-Day RoutineThis is a full-time position with our Data Analytics Team, and all employees are required to work on-site at our studio in Dallas, Texas. Data Team employees typically work 40-50 hrs/wk depending on projects and milestones. We make every effort to keep hours close to 40 hours per week.The Analyst works independently, takes responsibility for specific Data Analysis tasks, and collaborates with cross-department teams to tackle more complex projects and analysis.The Analyst will develop mathematical models and collaborate with others to research and resolve problems. The Analyst will present research results to others.Vet in-game Instrumentation and Data Quality: Our mobile games track event data whenever something happens during gameplay. We collect all this event data in our backend data warehouse and routinely pull, slice, dice, and aggregate data for input into the analysis, models, reports, and dashboards. We utilize several different 3rd party solutions within our games and import data from various sources for use with our analysis.Work with Game Designers and Programmers to ensure events are firing and that all events contain the correct data parameters and values.Run reports against our Data Warehouse to identify issues related to instrumentation.Ensure we are capturing all necessary data to be able to answer questions.Vet data values using different sources to proactively identify problems (errors, bugs, missing data, etc.).Experimental Design: We are continually optimizing our games and rolling out new features. The Analyst will work with our Data Team &amp; Game Designers to help design experiments around new in-game features, game mechanics/balance changes, and changes to game balance.Identify appropriate techniques for answering questions.Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) and what data we need to capture to calculate each KPI'sHelp set up in-game A/B Split Tests - split testing allows us to segment new players into separate groups and give each a different experience. We can then measure any differences between these groups and infer which variant performs "better" - at which point, we can optionally roll that experience out across all new players.Perform AB Test Analysis and write reports for each experiment we runGame Health and Performance: The Data AnalyticsBuild reports and dashboards to help track how our games are performing across a host of standard KPI'sBuild and maintain reports that help us determine and track player value across different game versions and user acquisition sources (i.e., marketing channels).Answer one-off Questions for Game Design, User Acquisition, and Quality Assurance and produce written reports with summary data, charts, and interpretation/explanatory notes.Build/maintain Tableau dashboards - All our Tableau Dashboards sit atop our live Data Warehouse.Build automated ETL processing scripts in python - We utilize AirFlow and python for all scheduled data processing jobs.Write SQL to pull data for analysis and reports.Technologies We Useprogramming: Python (JetBrains PyCharm IDE), R (R Studio), Jupyter Labsreporting tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Tableau Online, GoogleDocs/GoogleSheets, LucidChartsdatabases: SQL, SnowFlake, AWS Aurora RDS (MySQL)infrastructure: Amazon Web Services, Linux, Shell Scriptingmodeling: regressions, neural networks, XGBoost, classification algorithms, Bayesian Inference, etcsource control: GIT (GitHub)QualificationsA passion for video games and intellectual curiosity about how players interact in and with game systemsMust have 1+ years experience working directly with mobile game data analysis.MSc in Data Science, Statistics, or related degree with 2+ years of professional experience - OR -BS in Statistics, Math or related degree with 4+ years of professional experienceKnowledge of Calculus, Statistics, Linear Algebra and their application to solving problems3+ years of expertise and hands-on experience with SQL:Advanced SQL skills querying large, complex datasets using relational databasesExperience with SnowFlake and MySQL (Note: we do NOT use MS SQL Server nor Oracle)Solid skills with advanced aggregation functions, windowing functions, grouping, subselects, and complex JOINS with many tablesExperience with troubleshooting and optimizing complex SQL using built-in tools for exploring how scans and indexes will be used3+ years of hands-on experience and solid proficiency with Python:Computational Programming with PythonPython Visualization libraries (e.g., matplotlib, ggplot, Seaborn, Plot.ly or equivalent)Statistical modeling and Regressions Analysis (Scipy, scikit-learn, Statsmodel, Pandas, Numpy, etc.)1+ years of hands-on experience building Tableau Dashboards, supporting datasets, and SQLStrong data interpretation, visualization, and presentation skillsUnderstanding of experimental design (e.g., setting up A/B Split Tests)Ability to explain statistical approaches/models, rationale/merits of different approaches, results, and interpretation to team membersAble to work effectively in a collaborative team environmentQuick thinker and fast coderWillingness and ability to take ownership as technical lead of a projectCompany BenefitsFree Employer covered Health Insurance (including family)Paid Vacation &amp; Sick timeFlextime (employees have some flexibility to set their hours of work)Quarterly bonuses (based on company &amp; individual performance)Equity OptionsCompany parties and social functions (quarterly)Game nights -
